p: Before initiating either of these strategies, we need to estimate the basic reproductive number (R 0), or the more ‘real-life’ effective reproductive number (R t) for a given population. R 0 is the number of secondary cases generated by the presence of one infected individual in an otherwise fully susceptible, well-mixed population. R t is a more practical real-life version of this, which uses real-life data (from diagnostic testing and/or clinical surveillance) to estimate the reproductive number for an ongoing epidemic.
